availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin Van Buren Darnall (Caldwell County, Ky, farmhand)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand. Dawson Springs, Kentucky native. Son of James Van Darnall and Mary Copeland Darnall. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Princeton in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 354A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 102.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 226B.
Utah Death Certificates, 1904-1961, Office of Vital Records and Statistics, Utah State Archives, Salt Lake City, UT, File #172536.
